page.title: 01 STOTFOLD and DISTRICT
page.content: { The area around {Stotfold} is mainly flat agricultural land where {arable} farms predominate.The soil is light clay with beds of gravel and gault subsoil.The{River Ivel}flows north then west through the area from Baldock to the R.Ouse .The river provides drainage and irrigation for the farm land. Stotfold is the main town of the area with the villages of{Astwick}and{ {Caldecote}only supporting small communities. Stotfold is a town and parish on the road from{Bedford}to{Baldock}(A507> on the Hertfordshire border.The{A1}trunk road passes to the east of the town.
